alert.note: Alert for Douglas; Franklin; Shawnee (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Freeze Warning issued April 18 at 3:34AM CDT until April 19 at 9:00AM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...FROST ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM CDT THIS MORNING... ...FREEZE WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 3 AM TO 9 AM CDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the Freeze Warning, sub-freezing temperatures as low as 31 expected. For the Frost Advisory, temperatures as low as 35 will result in frost formation. * WHERE...Shawnee, Douglas and Franklin Counties. * WHEN...For the Freeze Warning, from 3 AM to 9 AM CDT Tuesday. For the Frost Advisory, until 8 AM CDT this morning. * IMPACTS...Frost and freeze conditions will kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing.
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.
